titleStmt.title: The saylors departure from his dearest love, wishing that still (to him) she'd constant prove she (in the second part) doth thus reply, e're she'd from him depart, she'l chuse to dye. To a new tune of, Adieu my pretty one.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Wright, J. Clarke, W. Thackeray, and T.P.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "Now I am bound to the seas ..."
In two parts. The second part has title: Her answer.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
